messages.title: Welsh Assembly Elections
messages.content: This coming Thursday you will have the opportunity to re-elect your representatives to the National Assembly for Wales. And, as I am standing for re-election as your Welsh Assembly Member, I thought I would take the opportunity to write to you.

mentions.tacticalSituation: In Clwyd West the election is a straight fight between an experienced Assembly Member with a proven track record and a Labour candidate whose party have left Wales the poorest part of the United Kingdom and want to axe 300 jobs in the health service over the next 3 years.

issues.health: want to axe 300 jobs in the health service over the next 3 years

housing.content: I don't want to see unnecessary development in our beautiful countryside that blights our town centres, many homes and businesses or members of our community at an unacceptable risk of flooding and I will work to ensure we achieve a sustainable balance for the future.

leaflet.personalStatement: As a person who lives in the constituency, I am committed to providing a strong voice for Conwy and Denbighshire in Cardiff Bay, Having successfully campaigned for local health services, flood defences, offices, rural broadband, town centre regeneration and more, I have a record of action on the things that matter to local people.

contactInformation.address: Campaign Headquarters, Clwyd West Conservatives, 3 Llewelyn Road, Colwyn Bay, LL29 7AP

images.caption: Image of Darren Millar with a caption 'Darren Millar A record of action, a promise of more'

leaflet.additionalNotes: In the referendum on changing our voting system I strongly urge you to vote 'No' to AV. A change in the system could lead to a candidate coming third in the ballot getting elected. This is no way to run a democracy.
